pull.title: depends: remove Darwin ENV unsetting
pull.body:
Now that we use the native compiler, and have fixed Qt, and these vars
are (almost) unset in Guix, we can remove the unsetting from our compiler
command here.

I couldn't manage to make a darwin-clang-cross only exclusion of `-lm` work properly
for Qt, so opted for just removing the explicit link entirely. I do not think this should have
any other unwanted side-effects.

Fixes #21552.

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

Whoa, this greatly simplifies things. When/why where these removed in guix? I thought they were pretty fundamental there.

I wonder if we should check for the use of these in depends and bail out if they're set though.

> When/why where these removed in guix? I thought they were pretty fundamental there.

I've added some more cleanup here. We can't remove them entirely (for Darwin) in Guix, because we still need some set during depends, for QT/qmake... However, we can unset them after that, for the main build.
Assuming that #29723 lands first, the commit here adding a patch for librt will be dropped, as that is also patched out of the CMake side in that PR.
Dropped the (autotools) zeromq commit and rebased on top of #29723.

verification.payload:

events.message: guix: improve ENV unsetting for macOS

verification.payload:
tree 6846385edd7d1e25a631c4777e7c2e5dfde0bec0
parent 1807760f094b600fdebe4ebd0018e4fd5d506ce9
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1720793826 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1721913505 +0100

depends: remove ENV unsetting for darwin

Now that we use the native compiler, and have fixed Qt, and these vars
are unset it Guix, we can remove the unsetting from our compiler command
here.

Fixes #21552.

events.message:
depends: remove ENV unsetting for darwin

Now that we use the native compiler, and have fixed Qt, and these vars
are unset it Guix, we can remove the unsetting from our compiler command
here.

Fixes #21552.

events.body:
ACK bda537f7c484d61a55a72c5856f2d4420664db8f

Tested the gui on macos 12.7.4

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -69,13 +69,22 @@ unset CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH
 unset OBJC_INCLUDE_PATH
 unset OBJCPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH
 
-export C_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
-export CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
-export OBJC_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
-export OBJCPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
+case "$HOST" in
+    *darwin*)
+        # Required for qt/qmake
+        export C_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
+        export CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
+        ;;
+    *)
+        export C_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
+        export CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
+        export OBJC_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
comments.body: If I am reading this right, this sets OBJC vars for non-darwin hosts. Is that intended? I would have expected the opposite.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -69,13 +69,22 @@ unset CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH
 unset OBJC_INCLUDE_PATH
 unset OBJCPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH
 
-export C_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
-export CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
-export OBJC_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
-export OBJCPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
+case "$HOST" in
+    *darwin*)
+        # Required for qt/qmake
+        export C_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
+        export CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
+        ;;
+    *)
+        export C_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
+        export CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
+        export OBJC_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
comments.body: Heh, yea. These should/would only be needed for macOS, and only for Qt-related code. I guess everything still currently builds even with them unset, because when we compile our objc++ code, we would never be looking in any GCC related include/std-lib/related dirs in any case? Will push some changes.
